website_summaries.verdict: If you need the tapeworms gone quickly, this dewormer does the trick.
pros: Clears up tapeworm problems in just 1 day
Works quickly and effectively, better than an injection
Does not seem to have any side effects for the cats
cons: This product only contains 3 pills per bottle

customer_reviews.title: Wear jeans & long sleeves
customer_reviews.text: Hi there I'm Dr. Love. I'm dictating this for my human. I had yucky tapeworms and was leaving 'rice ' everywhere. I'm 13.5 lbs, and Mom gave me 1 1/4 pills. No side effects (except Mom's loud scream & deep scratch on her leg)... And within 24h, no more tapeworms! It's now 2 weeks later & I'm still clear -- it works!
customer_reviews.author: T-in-Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Veterinarian Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 16 week old kittens and it worked well. After I gave to to them I took them to the vet the next day to get shots. I told the vet that I gave them this and he said it was the best tapeworm medicine to give them. I asked how long it would take for the tapeworm to pass and he said that the very next day after giving them the medicine the tapworm should be gone. He told me that I should give one more dose in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Making a second & third purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a peice of tapeworm in his vomit and after hours of research because my vet was booked well over a month; I decided on purchasing this product for my adopted street kitty who was hungury 27/4. He was skin and bones with a large head and an "old kitty butt." Now he is all muscle and very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Stisty

customer_reviews.title: we all love it and swear by it
customer_reviews.text: Directions aren't clear, but this is the only worm treatment that works on my cats. Just feed them one pill, and by the next day, you won't see worms anymore. I don't even bother with any other treatments because I know this is going to work. I've turned my friends and family onto this product as well, we all love it and swear by it. Please note: 3 pills comes to one bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle E.

customer_reviews.title: Important Info
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Please note: Most Cats are under 5 pounds, give your cat only 1/2 a Pill -- this is important! 1/2 Pill Once per MONTH if Worms are still present. Get a square of cheese, a small bite-sized piece, and stuff the 1/2 of a Pill inside and your Kitty should take it right down. Please remember, 1/2 Pill once per Month if needed, that's One Half of a Pill. Not every day, not once a week. Once per Month!
customer_reviews.author: MikeFrett

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my four cats who all have tapeworms from fleas. They all love tuna. I crushed each dose and put it in a teaspoon of tuna and they refused to eat it! I am very unhappy that I just threw away $34.58 (2 boxes). It would not be an easy tablet to shove down their throats either so it had to be crushed and feed with food. They must taste the chemicals that are mixed with the tuna. What a terrible product. Unless you want to push it down your cats throat, avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: ptcldarrin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you love your cat!
customer_reviews.text: My cat just sniffed it and start burp. After that I'm with my wife ,together, tried to feed cat this tablet,out cat bitten me 2 fingers!! Eventualy she ran away from us and started to vomiting foam... Our cat is so small(8pounds) ,but we figured out that she has a lot of hidden power,thank you for it Bayer!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: HELL NO!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ever seen a cat cry? As in literally? How about FOAM at the Mouth, EXTENSIVELY!?! And worde, INSTANTLY, while looking utterly TERRIFIED. 1/2 half a pill, was in my small cats mouth for maybe... 2 seconds, she spit it out, and produced a 4" line of saliva instantly . Physical tears shooting out her eyes, I didn't even know that was possible for a cat!!! And a terrified expression as she walk swiftly in circles confused with a HUGE glob of saliva that instantly appeared and was THICK!!! Wow... never again.
customer_reviews.author: Badger Powder

customer_reviews.title: Cat lady here
customer_reviews.text: We have a farm and sadly, each cat we have has been 'donated' (in other words, abandoned for nice ppl like us to care for). Here is my advice: if you have cats that vomit, pull at their hair (especially around their tail, towards their tail, on their sides), lose weight, cough, or have chronic cold symptoms (including coughing/sneezing blood or mucous) they probably have tapeworms. Parasitic control will save you money in the long run AND prevent your cat from discomfort and probable demise. Tapeworms are common with larger populations or crowded populations of kitties. Thankful to have found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend...
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm... after the 3 tablets my cat was back to normal, great stuff. As for how I chose to administer these pills, I made it very easy on myself. All I did was purchase a good brand of moist cat food (my cat eats only dry as she got older, so moist was a treat for her) I crushed up the pill and added it to only a tablespoon of cat food so I knew she would finish every last drop, and that was it. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bertolino

customer_reviews.title: Does Exactly What It Says
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! I had 5 kittens I fostered last summer and this got rid of their worms plus the worms they spread to our 3 cats. I make sure to do another dose 2 weeks after the first and control for fleas in addition to giving them these pills. My vet also recommended them as a good OTC treatment. Amazon sells them for much cheaper than pet stores, although I do wish it came in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyTop Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Killed my kitten in less than one day.
customer_reviews.text: I gave my 6 week old kitten half a tablet. That night he wouldn’t eat and began to have diarrhea. I feed him milk replacement for kittens every four hours and water every hour. He still became dehydrated and passed away. Very upset and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Something's Missing!
customer_reviews.text: I received my order promptly but was disappointed to find only ONE pill inside the bottle. The label clearly states 3 pills are enclosed but there was definitely only one. Yes, there was a foil seal in tact on the bottle too. I will be contacting Amazon to try and get a proper replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sackmama

customer_reviews.title: Causes vomiting
customer_reviews.text: I crushed a pill up and mixed with Gerber chicken and gravy baby food. The cat ate a few spoonfuls, then refused to eat anything else. Copious vomiting ensued. I called Bayer’s contact number at about 9:30pm- and they actually answered. They recommended I try to redose the cat. No thanks. The cat is still refusing to eat normal food hours later. Will be taking the cat to the vet for either an injection or topical dewormer.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Worked great once I got the cat to cooperate.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is one that does not like any other food other than her dry food. I tried a bit of canned food and mashed a pill into the gravy from it. No go. She licked it a little bit, but that's it. 2nd pill - used the gravy from another can and mashed a pill into it. I used a dropper-style/plunger type medicine dropper normally used for giving my cat medicine. Well, this is technically medicine, so. It was just large enough to get the gravy/pill mix into it and into my cat's system. That was 2 weeks ago, and I haven't seen a "rice grain" or "sesame seed" since!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: This is dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my cat according to product instructions and my cat's weight. Day one my cat had really bad diarrhea. Then following this my cat has not eaten for three days. She is barely drinking any water. She is doing nothing but laying on the floor on the carpet. her third eyelid is showing she is clearly incredibly sick from this. Do not give this to your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne2117

customer_reviews.title: work well
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country and of course cats are often dumped at farms, etc... so a few who were apparently indoor cats love to stay close and come inside at times. two times, I've needed this product and works well, quickly and thoroughly. No complaints from my end. I'm not sure on the flavor part, (I've never tasted myself!) but no issues getting them down with my cats. Somewhat pricey for 3 tablets, but if needed often & you're sure of what it is, it does save over a vet visit.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Must taste like crap.
customer_reviews.text: My cats will not take a pill, so I crushed these and but in their food. I tried chicken broth first, which they love. Wouldn't touch it. Next I tried in their regular wet food, wouldn't touch it. Last I tried mixing the chicken broth with their wet food, wouldn't touch it. It must smell or taste so bad that my cats would not get near it. I have no Idea if it works. I would ask for a refund if I hadn't used it all trying to get any of my cats to take it. It was a total waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Honestly
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral stray that decided to move into my front porch and I have zero experience with cats! I noticed the signs and symptoms of a tape worm and after speaking with a few vets who refused to treat the cat because he is feral, I decided to visit Petco and got a homeopathic version that I used religiously for two weeks and it did nothing. I finally came on Amazon, found this product, gave one dose in his wet food that he ate with no problem in one sitting and the worm was completely gone within about two days. Amazing. Honestly. So happy and glad they give you more than one dose so there is extra.
customer_reviews.author: Love&Wishes

customer_reviews.title: YOU GUYS!  These are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I fed these to my 4 year old cat and the tapeworms were gone by the next day. I just sat her on the tape, held her little jaw and barely pushed on the sides of her mouth to get her to open it, leaned her head back, dropped the pill in, and then blew on her nose a bit while keeping her mouth shut. She swallowed it like a champ. Then I gave her some yummy tuna to help with digesting it. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah S.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: One day day I saw something white on the back end of my cat. I picked it off and watched it and it began to move. It was a tape worm. I was going to take him to the vet when I thought of Amazon and found these pills. I crushed one up in his food. It dewormed my cat. He has regained his appetite, his tail has perked up and his fur is nice a shiny. I saved fifty bucks. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: L.W. Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My out door feral cat lost weight and I was worried. After trying other dewormers, I purchased this one. Within weeks, my kitty regained his weight and is healthy again. What a relief, he is a darling and I want him to live forever!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian A. Collins

customer_reviews.title: works.  plain and simple.
customer_reviews.text: Our vet sells these for $45 a pill. Same pill. This is usually $14-$15 for THREE. Better deal. We have 10 cats inside and outside varieties. (all spayed and neutered) Seems like in June a few tend to get tapeworms. I recognize the symptoms and treat them. I had to mark it down for flavor because I am gathering they taste terrible. I really have to hide it in food. Some won't take them in food. They KNOW. We have been using this brand for years and they are really a good value and a good product to have on hand. I will definitely repurchase in the future and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar Grove Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Extremely handy to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when the brand of tapeworm tabs I was buying disappeared a few years ago. They were less expensive than these Bayer brand ($10 for 3 tabs vs. $15 for 3 tabs). But for awhile the only substitute I could find was prohibitively expensive, so I couldn't get any. I was glad a couple of years ago (2017) when I discovered these available. They are indispensable to have on hand if you have cats that go outside and eat things they shouldn't (or for that matter even indoor cats that discover critters to eat that they shouldn't!).
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Tastes horrible. Buy a pill dispenser with it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Tastes horrible. Buy a pill dispenser with it. Unless your cat has no taste buds, it will not touch anything that has this medication mixed in with it. It's VERY bitter and impossible to mask the taste. I ended up having to buy another bottle at the local pet store ($10 more than the Amazon price) after wasting pills my mixing with tuna that the cats would not touch, except the one that eats anything you put in front of him, without chewing it. Once I got a pill dispenser, administering the pill was a snap, and it worked fast.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Priss

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my cat!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this dewormer to my cat and I followed the instructions. I thought it worked, but after a month that I medicated it to her, i noticed she was throwing up with worms. It was so Gross !!
customer_reviews.author: Chalin's

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Never is it easy to give cats a pill. Crushed it into powder form, mixed correct dosage for kitten's weight. Mixed with tuna water juice & used syringe to squirt into our saved kitty's mouth. Much easier than a pill. Kitty got only 1 dose & POOF worms are gone, no fleas. Kitten also got a warm bath, effectively stopping the flea cycle👍
customer_reviews.author: M & J

customer_reviews.title: My go to for cats
customer_reviews.text: Originally prescribed by my vet years ago. On rare occasion when cats do get worms it’s my go to pills because dosage is easy to understand as long as you know the weight of the cat. You should check with your vet to be sure this is the right medication of course. Each cat will accept the medicine differently so read the instructions on the bottle. I have one cat who just sits on my lap and swallows the pill and I have another one who I have to trick using cheese. But usually within 24 hours I can notice that the worms have left their stool.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not for every cat.
customer_reviews.text: I know this works from experience with other cats, but the one I have now will not eat anything I put it in! Trying to get the capsule down her throat only leads to much bleeding on my part. Went to my vet and bought a dose of Profender; cost me $17.90. It is a topical that you just put on their skin between their shoulder blades (like the flea stuff). (It works for tapeworm, hookworm and roundworm.) You're done. It's easy. No trauma to the cat or scratches to you. Works. Well worth the money. My vet does her outside cat twice a year. You may need to do more often if you don't use routine flea control.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Harris

customer_reviews.title: The pills work great ... avoiding blood loss and stitches is the challenge.
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions on my 20 lb resident mooch. Had a tapeworm but this took care of it. Hardest part was figuring out how to get the pill down the little monster's throat. Lost some blood but finally figured out that wrapping him up in a bath towel like a papoose and dousing the pill in butter was the fastest (and safest) way to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: FromTheCouch

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend getting a liquid version
customer_reviews.text: My cat refused to swallow this pill. I tried hiding it inside of some cat food, force feeding it, and grinding into a powder to mix in with cat food. Nothing worked. My cat could taste and smell it as if I was feeding him a chlorine tablet. I ended up switching to a liquid version of this type of medicine and I poured it over some tuna fish. He not only ate all of the tuna, he licked the bowl clean. This pill form was a waste of money though. For those who are curious, the brand that worked for me was "Prosense Liquid Cat Dewormer".
customer_reviews.author: Eddie H

customer_reviews.title: Cat wouldn't take it
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work because cat wouldn't take it. Tried it in her favorite foods and she knew something wasn't right about the food. Need to make this stuff appealing to cats. Needs to smell and taste like what they normally injest. Waste of money for me. Perhaps if your cat's senses are filled or you have a dumb cat or even a cat that just doesn't care it may like this product but as far as my cat goes nothing would get her to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Possum

customer_reviews.title: Effective tapeworm treatment
customer_reviews.text: One application of this 23mg praziquantel tablet to treat a 16y/o 11lb cat was all that was needed to eliminate his tapeworms. Tablet was crushed into powder and mixed with soft food. Cat was put off by the taste initially but whatever he didn't finish was just refrigerated and offered to him later until he ate all of it. Within 24 hours after his treatment, no more tapeworm segments were observed on his backside.
customer_reviews.author: v3r0k457

customer_reviews.title: Same medicine as the vet's office but without the inflated price.
customer_reviews.text: My two kittens were rescued from a bad situation and were very sick. One of them had worms coming from his behind. I took them to the vets for topical dewormer, which didn't work. The vet wanted $20 a piece for one tablet. I ordered this overnight and it worked perfectly. They were so small that they only needed half of a pill, so I still have enough for two more doses later in the year for maintenance. This is the same thing you'd get at the vet's for a fraction of the price. If you aren't in a hurry, buy it from Amazon and save. I'm all for people making a profit, but that was ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: awgoodkitty

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cats!
customer_reviews.text: Noticed my baby had tapeworms and one dose of this knocked it right out : ) no adverse side effects for us so I would recommend but obviously when self treating your cat with anything always be prepared to call your vet if anything goes wrong. But from what I've heard and experienced this is really safe. Most likely anything bad that people say has happened after using this was coincidence or possibly aggravated a preexisting problem. : ) Its always best to check with your vet and make sure your cat is healthy before giving them any sort of medication.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Doe Willow

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works
customer_reviews.text: My friend adopted a kitten which unknowingly had fleas. The fleas ended up in my home but I was able to eradicate them before the infestation became worse. However... it is possible for fleas to infect cats with tapeworms (Google: "fleas and worms in cats" in you're curious, but take my word for it). I noticed worms in/on my cat and needed medicine fast. I was able to trick my cat using Greenies Pill Pocket treats and by cutting up the pill into small chunks. My cat experienced NO issues and had no side-effects from taking the medicine. His only side-effect: no more worms! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works great....all my fingers and arm are defleshed but the kitties got their pill
customer_reviews.text: Okay putting a pill in food doesn't work with cats like it does dogs. Dogs inhale and never notice usually. Cats will eat the treat and leave the med. Wrapping a cat and putting a pill down their throats is the same as putting a towel around your arm and sticking it into a running wood chipper...not fun. Anyways I battled all 8....yes ....8 and got them down. Just a note if you made a chewable in tuna flavor I would pay the little extra.
customer_reviews.author: txmnj

customer_reviews.title: Like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 5vstars because it worked excellently deworming my cat. Unfortunately, my little guy is a but particular when it comes to taste and acts like a complete psycho when you try and sneak pills into his food. SO I crushed up the suggested amount, mixed it with water, and put it into an oral syringe. He is much better at taking medicine that way. Only draw back is that it ended up being, like, 6 syringes full, sontge process was slow but ultimately effective! In the end, I'm just happy it worked that way and he's worm free!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: GET IT !!!
customer_reviews.text: Get it! Crush it up. Add some liquid. Put it in a [liquids] syringe. Squeeze into cat! Wake up the next day to no more sesame seed butt worms or mushy white noodley butt worms. All gone overnight and it's been days and they haven't come back. Tried to get cat to swallow it and she gagged. They're big. I already had the [liquids] syringes. Also switched to Advantage II since Frontline no longer prevents flea infestation.
customer_reviews.author: Alex82

customer_reviews.title: Easy deworming solution
customer_reviews.text: Mashed this up and put this in wet food for my kitten. My male cat gobbled it right up. My female cat (who is admittedly a bit pickier when it comes to her food) definitely noticed the flavor difference. I had to leave this as her only source of food all day before she finally finished it and got the proper dose. BUT once the pill was consumed, both cats were worm free within a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This formula effectively rid my kittens of tapeworm in one dose. The tapeworms were observed in the kittens fur, the only way to verify tapeworm as they will not reliably show up on fecal tests. I gave each kitten (13 weeks old at the time) 1/2 a tablet by placing the tablet in the back of their mouth, and gently holding their mouth closed while stroking their throat. They won't feel great for a day, that's too be expected and in difficult cases they may puke. This is a way the cats expel worms and in some cases a necessary side effect of the medicine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jervis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: My two barn cats were showing telltale signs of tapeworm (worms coming out of their hind ends and little white “sesame seeds” around it). I bought two small cans of wet food and added one crushed pill per can. They wolfed down the food around 8pm. The next morning these cats were like kittens again. They were running around like crazy, chatting up a storm. Even my husband noticed, and I hadn’t told him I had medicated them. This product was a quick, affordable option to help keep my cats healthy. It saved me a trip to the vet, which costs time and money and stresses my cats out. Thank you for this product!
customer_reviews.author: megan8477

customer_reviews.title: No more wasted money at the vet
customer_reviews.text: We have two kittens who had worms. We took them to two vets, which administered a total of three de-wormer treatments and we continued to see eggs and worm pieces. Finally broke down and bought this. Once cat vomited a couple hours after. Next morning no worms or eggs were present. We watched for two more nights and nothing was being left like before. Such a great product. That being said the pill is about the size of a typical aspirin tablet so your cats are no going to be too happy swallowing this. I would absolutely by this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Took care of our cat’s tapeworm issues affordable, without a trip to the vet! definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: EASY DE-TAPEWORMING PILLS
customer_reviews.text: I followed another reviewers suggestion with putting a quarter of a pill inside four Greenies Pill Pockets and our cat that normally sniffs out any medication gobbled them up. However, our other elderly cat who eats most things wouldn't touch them. The first cat though did vomit her morning food up which was probably 18 hours after having had the pills. This is one of the common side affects that I have read about and will be keeping an eye on her. I don't know if she's been dewormed as she is an indoor/outdoor cat. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: They work awesome, use a syringe!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I crush up the pill add a tiny bit of hot water, let it dissolve and suck it up in a syringe. Squirt it down cats mouth. No fuss no muss! Works like a charm. Tried hiding it in all kinds of food, he would eat around it or spit it out or not eat the food at all. Tried the butter, peanut butter thing just got scratches for the effort. This stuff works well. My cat is 11 lbs one pill every 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Worked with 1 dose!
customer_reviews.text: We have a stray cat who likes to visit us outside who had a bad case of worms. COVID cases in our state are very high and mask-wearing is "optional" so many people choose not to wear a mask- including people visiting the vet office. Helping this stray at home was our best option. After wrapping them in a blanket it was easier to place the pill in his mouth. After one pill the worms were gone and he is beginning to gain weight again. Once our state straightens out its priority about mask-wearing we will take the cat to the vet. In the meantime, I would highly recommend this product for at-home treatment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lore

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye tapeworm
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Noticed our newly adopted cat dropping tapeworm segments and this did the trick. Can’t speak to how easy it is to swallow or the flavor like amazon is asking me, but I’m very comfortable pilling cats, and he took it no problem (did not freely eat it, but I don’t mess around with that). I’m fairly certain just one pill did the trick for our cat (make sure you know your cats weight and dose appropriately), however my boyfriend was paranoid it wasn’t enough so we re-dosed about a week later and haven’t noticed any tapeworm segments since (it’s been a month since last dose).
customer_reviews.author: Laurel P

customer_reviews.title: For Feral Cat
customer_reviews.text: When we notice little dried up tan pieces (in the feral cats winter shelter bed), we add one of these into her wet food. The wet food has to be flavorful and moist enough to drown out the pill taste. I crush it then moisten it with broth and syringe into the food. Works. Last time she didn't eat it, so I may break it up between two meals. I give it every couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Pink

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my 3 cats. The next day I saw no worms. Not sure why some are giving this a bad review all because they couldn’t get their cats to take it. That’s not the products fault. I have 3 VERY stubborn cats and a quick YouTube video and a towel helped me pill all 3 of them in less than 5 min. I’m so glad that amazon sells this product for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: JBD

customer_reviews.title: Killed my cat's worms
customer_reviews.text: I found a live, white worm on my cat's b-hole: I'm assuming a stray I pet a week before had fleas and I transferred some eggs to my poor kitty. Well, I got theses along with a pill syringe (look it up, it's amazing) and pushed them down his and our other cats' throats and now they're all worm-less. I ordered two just in case I had to re-administer to all three cats, but I didn't need to, so I guess I have one for later if I ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: My older cat had worms, which he's never had before and frankly I have no idea how he got them, either (indoor cat). I purchased this product, put it in his food, he noticed no difference because he ate like usual, and voila...worms gone. I guess it took a couple of days because I didn't look right away, just a couple days later. Good price for a product that worked so fast. He hasn't had any issues since!
customer_reviews.author: At Home With Daneen

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I had one of my barn cats that needed deworming. So I figured on trying these. I crushed the pill into a fine powder and sprinkled only a small portion of it on his wet food. I did that knowing he wouldn't eat the all the powder in one sitting. Even the I feed it to him in three portions, and he tried to pick around it the best he could, it worked. Worms were gone by the next week.
customer_reviews.author: DFB

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great- Much Cheaper Than A Vet Trip.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for one of our cats who caught tapeworms from a flea that made its way inside.. It's fairly obvious when your cat has a tapeworm, you'll start to notice small white things wherever your cat sits, kind of like a small grain of rice. Anyway, it came in a small bottle with 3 pills. I separated my cats, crushed two up, and gave one to each mixed into some wet food. Within a few days, saw no more symptoms and we've got 1 extra pill in case something stupid happens again. Be sure to completely change out their litter after treatment is done.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brett

customer_reviews.title: Worked the very first time!
customer_reviews.text: I had to place the pill in my cat's mouth and hold her mouth shut until she swallowed it (which was not a fun experience for either of us), but it worked on the first try! She was worm free after only a few days! Great value for an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I am glad a tapeworm dewormer is not available without having to go through the vet. I gave this to my outside cats who get tapeworm frequently from eating mice and other rodents. After a few days I stopped seeing the "rice" and haven't seen any since. Appears to work. I ground up the pill and put it in some wet food to make sure they ate it and didn't have any problems. I have also found this at WalMart, but Amazon subscribe and save is a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and i wouldnt recommend a second dose for at least two weeks
customer_reviews.text: gets all the tapeworms out of my babies. theyve had them twice now due to fleas, and its just unavoidable sometimes no matter how much you clean, depending on the area you live in. the most recent time we had just gotten a new stray kitten, and she was loaded with them. thanks to this, shes worm free! use as directed, and i wouldnt recommend a second dose for at least two weeks, i prefer to wait an entire month personally. this makes sure they are absolutely 100% tapeworm free.
customer_reviews.author: jesse kaherl

customer_reviews.title: Relief for All
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure it worked. The cats are happier and I do not see or hear any angry behavior. I had to use a pill injector to administer (also purchased online. Was easy to use). I had first tried crushing the pills with pill crusher (from the Dollar Store) and mixed in the food. All three cats refused to eat, even after waiting for half day, sitting there crying. I took the medicated food down to homeless cats. Received another round and used the handy safe pill injector.
customer_reviews.author: CabanaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased! Worked very well!
customer_reviews.text: We took in a stray kitten only to discover weeks later that he had tapeworms. We tried an all natural dewormer that had great reviews but it did not work for us but this did. We did one dose and they were gone. We will do another follow up dose just because that was recommended to make sure that they stay gone. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jinny

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: It only came with 3 pills. I 1st crushed it up to put in the soft food after reading some of the reviews. My cat was not at all interested. So I just gave him the 2nd pill orally and he did great! (Tossed the food and the 1st pill) I haven't noticed any of the signs that he was displaying (which is what caused me to read up on tapeworms and get the product in the 1st place). Overall I'd say it does the job that its supposed to and it was super easy to use. Id say if you can give your cat medicine orally go that route 1st.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Anyone looking to deworm their cat or kitten should most definitely buy these. easy and good price to make your cat healthy and happy. the pills seemed a bit large but they advise crushing them up. if you want to take an easier route and assure your cat is consuming it, you can watch a video on youtube on how to give a cat a pill. very easy and useful. I recommend putting some wet food or water on the pill prior to putting it in their mouth. hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: hailey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Did not get rid of the worms. I bought 3 boxes and wasted my money now I had to go to the vet and spend more money just to get rid of the worms. Don’t waste your money this is hard to give them because the pull is huge and they won’t eat it in cat food and the stuff at the vets is way better. It’s $15 per cat at the vet but you put it on them like flea medicine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These pills work!
customer_reviews.text: I love my vet but I couldn't keep paying to bring my cat in just for deworming. He's an outside cat and while doing an exceptional job at keeping the rodents off our property, the downside is he gets tapeworms several times a year. These pills really work! I don't notice any side effects after our cat takes one (he's about 9.5 lbs). I take one tablet, dissolve it in a tiny amount of milk, load the liquid in a syringe (without a needle!) , and squirt it gently down the cat's throat. Works every time!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie C.

customer_reviews.title: No More Worms
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t seen any worms within 24 hours after giving these pills to my cats so I assuming it’s worked this was my last resort for worming medications as taking multiple cats to the vet is quite pricey. I would definitely order these again the pills are actually quite easy to give to your cats (watch YouTube videos if you don’t know how to put the pill in the back of their throats)
customer_reviews.author: Jaynalyn Nakagawa

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Ex vet tech here, easy to use, mix with those new kitty tuna or chicken puree, Inaba treats are what I use. Of course my female at is horrible and I have to wrap her up in a towel and give it orally via syringe to her. Note to those giving via syringe make sure its the least amount of fluid mixed with the crushed up tab, you do not want fluid going down into the lungs. I make a paste with the Inaba puree and it comes to about 1.5 cc which I feed slowly into the mouth via syringe. Good luck you all! Love my furry little kids... even the challenging ones. ha ha
customer_reviews.author: BugBug2020

customer_reviews.title: Worm free.
customer_reviews.text: Pills are large to give to cats to swallow, which we had to do with two out of three whom refused to eat it in wet food, the buggers. This was treatment for a new kitten whose deworming from the adoptee didn’t 100% do the trick and prophylactic for the other two. It was a rough time getting the two to take it whole but it did the trick and that’s all we care about.
customer_reviews.author: Landra

customer_reviews.title: They worked
customer_reviews.text: Good thing there were three in this pack, tried to get the cat to eat it dissolved and mixed with food. No go on that. Then i tried wrapping little chunks of it in cheese. The damn cat was on to that trick too. So, the last pill, i dissolved in water and used as syringe to shoot it down the cats throat. MAN WAS SHE PISSED! But, at least i got it in there. Two days later, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Now he's worm free and doesn't hate me!
customer_reviews.text: I was very worried about how I was going to give my scaredy cat this pill. I had to burrito him years ago and he's still afraid of towels. We sat on the floor with a loaf of Trader Joes French Brioche that he loves, gave him a piece, gave him another piece that had the pill hidden in it, he ate it without even noticing the pill! Now he's worm free and doesn't hate me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Fluhrer

customer_reviews.title: horribly written - and this is coming from an RN
customer_reviews.text: The directions regarding the dosage are irresponsibly, horribly written - and this is coming from an RN. Only one pill is considered "a dose." Do not give your cat all 3 pills. The medication itself did work. I was treating a mostly feral cat who now lets me near him, but no way was I going to be able to get the huge pill down his throat. What worked perfectly was mixing a crushed pill with a small amount of Earth Balance buttery spread which I then smeared on his paws. He was pissed, but he licked it off - they hate having stuff on their paws so they'll be sure to 'clean.'
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I took it and I'm still alive
customer_reviews.text: I took them myself, I ate raw pork and wanted to be sure I didn't have a tapeworm.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: First job is to get it down your cat’s throat.
customer_reviews.text: So... as it turns out... Franklin has tapeworms. Got pills to treat both cats. The one w/ 24 razor sharp claws takes his pill like a champ. The old girl, with only back claws and like not more than 10 teeth put a super deep puncture wound in my husband’s thumb and nice slash on his forearm. I got 3 arm scratches, a belly scratch, and a small puncture on my thumb.... but damnit I got that pill down her throat 🤦‍♀️ I am optimistic that the blood loss will be well worth it! Will provide updates in a couple days. 🐱
customer_reviews.author: Tina Ward

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: The heartworm pills from Bear work great for my cats typically within 24 hours there were no more worms coming from their butt. I'm sure the flavor is mediciney so I can't give five stars on that two stars total And the ease of use couldn't be any more than a three considering it's a pill you're trying to jam down your pet's throat All that matters is it works
customer_reviews.author: R.O.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that was born feral that I trapped and brought inside my house. His feces was full of worms. I bought a different brand of dewormer at first and used that on him. Within a couple of months I noticed he was full of worms again. I bought this brand and gave him one dose and haven't seen worms in about 6 months. I would definitely recommend and purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This thing works and it was WAY cheaper than a trip to the vet. I do recommend to buy one of those contraptions to give your pet the pill, because crushing it or hiding it in the food did not work for us. In less than 3 days our babies were back in good health. We gave a 2nd dose two weeks later to kill whatever larvae might have been left behind. Its been maybe two months since we used it and our babies are still healthy and no sign of those nasty parasites/worms. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: liarantess

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This works! Me and my GF lived with our parents who had to have a dog. The dog would go in and out this dragging in fleas. Along with the fleas came worms. We finally decided to move out and we bought this for the worms have it to our cats and they were worm free after one dose. We used another medicine to first get rid of the fleas. This only works if you first get rid of the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Works every time
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Cat had worms, fur was dull and coarse from the effect of having them. The easiest way to give this to your cat is to wrap your cat in a towel set them on your lap and get it in their mouth. Put your index finger and thumb together to create a gentle muzzle so your cat can’t spit it out. They will swallow it and it works quick. A few weeks later cat is healthy with a shine to his coat. No cat I’ve had will eat this in food so if you try, your just wasting it.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Use only 1 pill every 2 weeks if your cat still continue to have worms.
customer_reviews.text: My kitty was abandoned or lost by its owner. He was starving and dirty. Found out he had lots of flea and I causes him to have worm since he was only about 4 months. I saw a pretty decent review on this so I thought i tried it out. I had to crush the pill and put it in his wet food to blend. He did detect ot after eating half haha. Have me the stare... I notice the worms were disappearing on his bed. So, I continued the second those after 2 weeks which is recommended by a veterinarian.
customer_reviews.author: Shiko

customer_reviews.title: Helped with my worm problems!
customer_reviews.text: I had a indoor out door cat, whom would frequently eat dead birds and rodents. By doing this he would get worms very often and it began to get costly at the vet since we have 3 other cats. So we bought this in the hopes of cutting down on the vets bills and needless to save the product worked very well. The only problem is that it is in pill form, so it can be pretty tricky to give to the cats. I recommend putting the medicine in a dry food/ wet food mixture to trick the cats into believing it's just regular food mixed into one.
customer_reviews.author: Chardonnay Adams

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had tape worms 2 different times .we had to use medication tool to give to our cat.pills are alittle large but cat was able to swollow them ok .this medicine really works!!! Got rid of them good but about 6 months later evidently ate a flea again.medicone worked well.followed directions to the letter.our cat did not experience any bad side effects at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Worked on the First Try!
customer_reviews.text: After trying two doses of the expensive dewormer that was prescribed by the vet for our 6-month kitten, we decided to trust the reviews of this product for treating his tapeworms. Within a few days of swallowing the tablet there was no evidence of tapeworms. To administer the medication, I held him by the scruff of the neck and used my other hand to open his mouth and drop one tablet in the back of his throat toward the top of his mouth. I don't think he even noticed. We were very satisfied with the product and will buy it again if he keeps locating and eating infected fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Alison B.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats, and there was a time where all three had worms. I ordered two of these, and gave the correct dosage to each cat. Within a day or two I didn’t see anymore worms. You do have to keep on eye in your cats though. Give them a bath, flea medication, etc...bc these worms can comeback if you don’t take preventative steps. Ps. I tried mixing with their food and they wouldn’t eat it, I suggest just dropping the pills down back if throat/hold mouth until they swallow.
customer_reviews.author: Richelle Smitley

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a proven product with out the vet ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a proven product with out the vet bill. If you have positively identified the " rice" looking worm eggs . This is very easy to use. It is three pills and gives you how much to give to your cat by weight. 1/2 pill under 5 lbs, 1 pill over 5 lbs, 1 1/2 pills up to I think it said 12 to 15 lbs. I recommend having a pill popper to administer this it is much safer for your fingers and easier to get in the back of the throat that way.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC! Significant difference in 24 hours and completed eradicated within 48 hours!!
customer_reviews.text: First off I want to say, the product REALLY works and quickly too. However my cats weren't exactly thrilled to get it. I broke the pill into fourths and opened their mouths and placed at the back of the throat. Within 24 hours I seen a significant change and within 48 hours they were gone. * On a side note you must treat all of your animals in home for fleas and kill any you may have in your home as an infected flea can continue to keep the cycle going. And warning to humans, the ingestion of an infected flea can pass the tapeworms to you.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Kimbrel

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get cat to swallow or eat it
customer_reviews.text: We used a Lixit Pill Popper to insert the Bayer Tapeworm Dewormer into the back of our cat's mouth. The first few times the pill wouldn't release from the Lixit Pill Popper, so I don't recommend this product. The next few times the pill did release and was at the back of this mouth, I had his head up and was stroking his throat just like the vet demonstrated but he didn't swallow it. Next I crushed the pill into his wet cat food and he didn't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I was recently adopted by an outdoor cat just begging to come inside, but he had tapeworms so here we are! I gave him one dose and I haven’t seen any tapeworms since. I tried to hide it in wet food, then in cheese, and finally had to use the ol’ shove-in-the-mouth technique which made him so mad at me that he went outside and didn’t come back for a day. BUT he doesn’t have worms.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Butt rice be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my poor kitty had the dreaded but common tapeworms. We began noticing what looked like off white almost rice grains around his rear and in his fur (long hair cat). Well with a click of a button, his magic pills arrived two days later. Of course he was not amused and is currently raising his paw in protest to Amazon. Poor kitty. But we got the pill down the hatch after a lengthy WWIII and two days later no more butt rice! Hopefully he appreciates it as much as we do. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: T & A

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job deworming my barn cats. I crushed the pills and mixed the powder in with some moist food and the gobbled it up. Neither cat got sick or had any ill effects. The next day and the day after, one cat passed some worms in his stool, so I believe it's effective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for pets
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well for what is intended. I have purchased it before and works fine. It is not small enough for cats of ANY size and with all Bayer products, if it dissolves in the pet's mouth, they will gag and stop eating for a long while. I guess is equivalent to the ASA from Bayer with no coat. I believe it is pretty expensive for only 3 tablets. I have not done my research but I'll bet there are compatible quality products with a less expensive tag.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: He was not happy and most of it ended up painting my walls
customer_reviews.text: My cat could definitely smell the medicine, so putting it in food was a bust. He's a big guy, so 3 pills only gave me two doses. I dissolved the second dose in milk and used a syringe to force feed him. He was not happy and most of it ended up painting my walls, so I wasn't sure he got enough of the actual medicine for it to be effective, but all signs of the tape worm have since cleared up, so I'm guessing it was successful. Though I'll know for sure in a couple months when I bring a stool sample to the vet for his annual check up.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It works as long as you get rid of the fleas also :)
customer_reviews.text: Cleared up my kitties tapeworms. You have to get rid of their fleas tho so you if you have a cat with worms and you give them this the worms will come right back if they come in contact with fleas which carry the tapeworms. What's also pretty great about this product is that you can search the active ingredient and information about the medical trials tests that they did on cats comes up which is reassuring. In the tests they gave cats 10x the dosage and they were all fine so you dont have to worry about giving them medicine which will make them sick. :) Hope your kitty gets better
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Graham

customer_reviews.title: Only cat tapeworm brand i buy
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. The pills are small but it’s hard to give a cat any size pill. I dissolve this in a small amount of water or milk and out in a medicine syringe and squirt it in the cats mouth. It’s quicker and not much fighting compared to trying to put the pill down their throat. This always works very well, even the next day you can see a difference in their fur if they have worms. Cats tend to mostly get tapeworms and this works.
customer_reviews.author: eor

customer_reviews.title: It Worked!
customer_reviews.text: Cured my little due who was getting sick and throwing up every couple of weeks. I didn't see the worms till the 3rd or 4th week so he had them for awhile before I knew but this did the trick and he's been much better going on several months now. I crushed the pill up in a bunch of tuna which I normally mix with dry food as part of his regular diet. If he could taste it that wasn't going to stop him from going to town on a some premium sea food.
customer_reviews.author: Operandi

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I got a refund because it didn't remove my cat's tapeworm, even though I gave him all of the pills over the course of a few days. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: robin677

customer_reviews.title: Kitty is worm free now!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when I noticed my cat had worms after consuming some outdoor vermin. I crushed it up into a powder, mixed it with a bit of water and put it into a syringe without a needle tip. Holding kitty, I was easily able to squirt the dose quickly and in one shot down kitty's throat. The worms are gone and kitty had no adverse reactions. I only gave her one pill. She is about 7lbs and 9 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Waldron

customer_reviews.title: The worms keep coming back
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's a problem with the medicine itself or if these worms are just very tough to get rid of but I have been giving her these pills along with flea treatments once a month for well over a year and they just keep coming back. After this bottle is through it looks like we may just have to finally get my poor cat to the vet to get rid of them once and for all.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: My cat had tapeworms last year - she was constantly throwing up and I found tapeworms in her stool. These pills seem to have done the trick as her symptoms stopped after 3 days. This option was also WAY cheaper as petco was trying to sell for 30 bucks (but they were out of stock anyway so). I'll probably purchase this again for the next time my (or a friend's cat) has tapeworms. It's cheap enough.
customer_reviews.author: katie kriner

customer_reviews.title: Way cheaper than pet stores
customer_reviews.text: We found a kitten and realized that he had worms. I treated all of my other animals (1 dog, 2 cats) with this but I went to a pet store in my hast to treat them. The kitten we treated with some holistic meds but it didn't really do anything. When I realized this and the kitten was old enough to take this I snagged it off of Amazon for about 1/2 price. The day after the meds there were no more worms!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Worked quickly and was very effective
customer_reviews.text: I noticed the tapeworms were gone within a day or so of giving my adult cat the dose. He's picky about food, but ground up & mixed with soft food he ate it up pretty quickly and with no fuss! Must not have been a medicine-y flavor.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuyInTexas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price..
customer_reviews.text: I tried other dewormers with not much luck, this one removed the tapeworms in all 3 cats and there was no re-occurrence for months. If you are giving these to a cat, make sure you have band-aids on hand. Lots of band-aids.
customer_reviews.author: Zarabeth Langer

customer_reviews.title: Buh Bye Tapeworm
customer_reviews.text: This med clears a tapeworm infection in one dose. My squirmy 5 month old kitten had tapeworm. She is impossible to pill. Since she is 4.5 lbs (low end of range for a whole tablet) I crushed a little less than one tablet, dissolved it in chicken bone broth and shot it into her mouth with a syringe. I washed all of her bedding and have been watching for more proglottids and so far have not seen any. Better than expensive visit to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Primeisaripoff

product_meta.title: Bayer Tapeworm Dewormer (Praziquantel Tablets) for Cats, 3-Count Praziquantel Tablets for Cats and Kittens 6 Weeks and Older
product_meta.description: If your cat has had fleas, there’s a chance they have tapeworms too. Tapeworm segments look similar to grains of white rice and are visible when stuck in your cat’s hair under the tail or by the back legs or in their poop. It’s not always obvious that your cat has tapeworms, so the best way to identify a problem is through an exam performed by a veterinarian. Use Bayer Tapeworm Dewormer for Cats to treat your pet. Cats' everyday grooming behavior puts them at risk for ingesting fleas, which means a risk of tapeworms. Fleas can carry immature tapeworms, and they are the main source of tapeworm infections in cats. A cat that has been infested by fleas may develop tapeworms. Outdoor cats that hunt small rodents may be at risk of infection from tapeworms as well. In addition to treating with tapeworm dewormer, take steps to control fleas and rodents on the premises in order to prevent reinfection; Otherwise another round of the tapeworm dewormer for cats will be necessary. This is especially true in cases of tapeworms transmitted by fleas where reinfection is almost certain to occur if fleas are not removed from the animal and its environment. Consult your veterinarian for assistance in the diagnosis, treatment and control of parasitism. Keep away from children.
feature_bullets: 3-count bottle of tapeworm dewormer for cats
Easy effective way to remove common tapeworms in cats
Tablets may be crumbled and mixed with food or taken by mouth
Tapeworm Dewormer for Cats will remove the common tapeworms, Dipylidium caninum and Taenia taeniaeformis, from cats and kittens
For use in cats over 6 weeks of age
